New Material (5-7 min)

co Review

co inverts tanru: A co B = B A

Place structure comes from word BEFORE co.

Complex co Chains

lo valsi co jungo co cnino

The word which-is-Chinese which-is-new. = A new Chinese word.

Each co adds a modifier to the head word (valsi).

Combining co with Other Tools

With fu'ivla:

mi pinxe lo djacu co glare co jinsa

I drink water which-is-hot which-is-clean.

With lujvo:

mi tavla bau lo bangu co cnino

I speak in a language which-is-new.

When to Use co

Use co when... Example
Head noun is important lo gerku co barda (the dog, big)
Building long chains A co B co C co D
Clarifying complex tanru lo valsi co jungo

Converting Between Forms

Normal Tanru With co
barda blanu gerku gerku co barda co blanu
cnino jungo bangu bangu co cnino co jungo
glare jinsa djacu djacu co glare co jinsa

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Convert to co

Rewrite using co:

  1. melbi jungo valsi → ?
  2. barda spano zdani → ?
  3. cnino rusko bangu → ?
Answers
  1. valsi co melbi co jungo
  2. zdani co barda co spano
  3. bangu co cnino co rusko

Exercise 2: Convert from co

Rewrite as normal tanru:

  1. prenu co sutra co barda → ?
  2. cukta co melbi co cnino → ?
Answers
  1. barda sutra prenu
  2. cnino melbi cukta

Exercise 3: Full Sentences

Translate using co:

  1. I see a new Chinese word.
  2. I drink hot clean water.
  3. This is a big Spanish house.
Answers
  1. mi viska lo valsi co cnino co jungo
  2. mi pinxe lo djacu co glare co jinsa
  3. ti zdani co barda co spano

Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I learn a new language." → mi cilre lo bangu co cnino
  2. "This is a beautiful word." → ti valsi co melbi
  3. "I speak Chinese." → mi tavla bau la junbau
